p: Compound 2 is commonly known as α-terpineol- β-D- O-glucopyranoside or α-terpinyl- β-glucoside. Nhiem et al. [ 31] isolated this compound from a methanol extract of Acanthopanax koreanum leaves, although it did not possess antioxidant activity. This compound is also found in other plant parts such as apricot fruits [ 29], sweet potatoes [ 30], the aerial parts of Ligularia alticola [ 32], and an ethyl acetate extract of Saccocalyx satureioides [ 33].
